titles.title: A bill to revise the short title of the Fannie Lou Hamer, Rosa Parks, and Coretta Scott King Voting Rights Act Reauthorization and Amendments Act of 2006.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S185-186)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

calendar.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.

action.text: Committee on the Judiciary. Reported by Senator Leahy with amendments. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 23.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

reference.label: text of measure as reported in Senate

vote.text: Passed Senate with amendments by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Ms. Jackson-Lee moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with twenty minutes of debate on S. 188.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

bill.summary: 7/1/2008--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was passed by the Senate on February 15, 2007. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Amends the Fannie Lou Hamer, Rosa Parks, and Coretta Scott King Voting Rights Act Reauthorization and Amendments Act of 2006 to change the short title to the Fannie Lou Hamer, Rosa Parks, Coretta Scott King, Cesar E. Chavez, Barbara C. Jordan, William C. Velasquez, and Dr. Hector P. Garcia Voting Rights Act Reauthorization and Amendments Act of 2006.
